p: Our previous study showed that LH exhibited in vitro anti-influenza activity with IC 50 ranging from 200 to 2000 μg/mL [ 1]. Here we demonstrated that LH also has a comparable antiviral potency against the SARS-CoV-2 virus with an IC 50 value of 411.2 μg/mL ( Fig. 2). Transmission electron microscopy (TEM) has been a potent tool to observe virus entry, virus particle assembly, viral ultrastructure, and budding from the plasma membrane [ 17]. To understand the antiviral details of LH, EM pictures were taken from each group. Abundant virus particles assembled at the surface of membrane, cytoplasm, and plasma vesicles in the SARS-CoV-2 infected cells, decreased in the treatment of LH at 600ug/mL. Notably, slight deformation of virus particles was seen in the LH treatment, which required us to make further studies.
